page.title: 01Twin Villages N/East of Diss
page.content: The twin villages of Burston and shimplig lie amist open and uninspiring agricultural land, broken only by the Norwich-London railway and the CEGB's national grid both running north/south. Burston is centred on its village green, church, chapel, shop, school, public house, and nationally famouse stribe school, Shimpling is miniscule - its church is being declared redundant, but will be preserved being of national architectural interest. whilst few individuals are directly employed in agriculture, Burston has the headquarters of a major family animal feedstufs manufacturer providing employment for 200 people. Local employment opportunities are also provided by a home and school for mentally handicapped childredn. Others are employed in service
